Ming Y. Chow
About Courses @ Tufts CV Talks

Results of a Password Cracking Contest in My Security Class (Fall 2016)

Nov 6, 2016

For my Introduction to Computer Security class that I teach once an academic year since 2012, I give a month-long lab in October to crack as many passwords as possible. For this year’s contest (opened on October 3, 2016), I used three different hash types: NTLM, MD5, and SHA-512. The password hashes:

I combed through the submissions today: 64 total submissions (students can submit multiple times but only the last submission will count). The answers:
